HDG.BT.content: dialectic, philosophical embarrassment, becomes superfluous—e.g. Aristotle ‘no longer has any understanding of it’
HDG.BT.linkedContent: dialectic, philosophical embarrassment, becomes superfluous—e.g. Aristotle ‘no longer has any understanding of it’

HDG.FS.content: standing opposites presupposes statement as proposition (Aussage), both appear [day/night] through play of negation [Heidegger discusses dialectic and its use of contradiction to make up truth, referencing Marx]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: standing opposites presupposes statement as proposition (Aussage), both appear [day/night] through play of negation [Heidegger discusses dialectic and its use of contradiction to make up truth, referencing Marx]

HDG.FS.content: no dialectic in Heraclitus, though his word is its impetus > what began after him: that “which the morning first found”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: no dialectic in Heraclitus, though his word is its impetus > what began after him: that “which the morning first found”

HDG.FS.content: difference btwn Descartes/Hegel: Descartes only sets foot on terra firma (feste Land) of “consciousness,” Hegel thoroughly traverses it > Hegel surveys this land, measures it, not mathematically: the measure is metaphysical/total/“absolute” [method is dialectic]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: difference btwn Descartes/Hegel: Descartes only sets foot on terra firma (feste Land) of “consciousness,” Hegel thoroughly traverses it > Hegel surveys this land, measures it, not mathematically: the measure is metaphysical/total/“absolute” [method is dialectic]

HDG.FS.content: tautology only possibility for thinking what dialectic can only veil: [“exclusive approach presenting access to Being” (?)]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: tautology only possibility for thinking what dialectic can only veil: [“exclusive approach presenting access to Being” (?)]

HDG.OHF.content: Kierkegaard documented pertinacity (Hartnäckigkeit) of dialectic most clearly, didn’t break free, his reading of paradox into New Testament/Christianity simply negative Hegelianism
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Kierkegaard documented pertinacity (Hartnäckigkeit) of dialectic most clearly, didn’t break free, his reading of paradox into New Testament/Christianity simply negative Hegelianism

HDG.OHF.content: dialectic has same source in error (Fehlerquelle) of that which it wishes to remedy: steps into already constructed context, though really there’s no context here > what’s missing in dialectic: radical fundamental looking (radikale Grundblick) toward and at object of philosophy, from which (on basis of which), aus dem selbst, the How of what is understood emerges in unity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: dialectic has same source in error (Fehlerquelle) of that which it wishes to remedy: steps into already constructed context, though really there’s no context here > what’s missing in dialectic: radical fundamental looking (radikale Grundblick) toward and at object of philosophy, from which (on basis of which), aus dem selbst, the How of what is understood emerges in unity

HDG.OHF.content: how dialectic places itself above phenomenology: 1) best phenomenology can do: define appearance of Spirit in its 1st stage 2) dialectic alone can penetrate irrational > it’s true, phenomenology is 1st stage of immediate knowledge—but only from point of view of dialectic [nothing can be decided here, dialectic already presupposed] > phenomenology does place limit on knowing (is that a defect?)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: how dialectic places itself above phenomenology: 1) best phenomenology can do: define appearance of Spirit in its 1st stage 2) dialectic alone can penetrate irrational > it’s true, phenomenology is 1st stage of immediate knowledge—but only from point of view of dialectic [nothing can be decided here, dialectic already presupposed] > phenomenology does place limit on knowing (is that a defect?)

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

HDG.OHF.content: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”

HDG.OHF.content: dialectic, in being negated, doesn’t call for direct grasping (Erfassen)/having [is there having in fundamental phenomenology?]
